column3: str
Maqali's son should have returned by now.
Speak with Chagur.
Speak with Maqali's son.
Report to Maqali.
Ah, if it isn't the khagan <If(PlayerParameter(4))>herself<Else/>himself</If>.
I am sorry to trouble you, but could I ask you to check on my son? I sent him to the Dawn Throne on an errand and he should have returned by now.
Word has it that there are some Oronir who resent the fact that our tribe triumphed in the Naadam. I worry that one of them may have done something to my boy.
Please ask Chagur as to my son's whereabouts. She should know if he is safe or not. I do hope I am worrying for nothing...
Please ask Chagur as to my son's whereabouts. She should know if he is safe or not. I do hope I am worrying for nothing...
Ah, khagan. To what do we owe the pleasure?
Yes, Maqali's son was here just a short while ago. The last I saw he was heading westwards with some hunters.
I do not imagine there is aught to worry about, but check on him by all means should you be concerned.
I do not imagine there is aught to worry about, but check on him by all means should you be concerned. He was headed off to the west the last time I saw him.
<pant> <pant> I cannot continue. My hands are covered in blisters. Wait, you are the khagan, are you not? What brings you here?
Father was truly that worried? After completing my errand, I began talking with these hunters, and they invited me to train with them.
I had always looked down on the Mol, but it was we who lost. There must be some secret to their strength. Come on, let us go another round!
My apologies but Father awaits my return. Perhaps I can join you again when my hands are not so sore. Thank you for the invitation.
Did you find my boy?
He must be hiding his true strength from us. There is no way we could have been defeated by such a weak tribe.
I am still too weak!
I just spoke with my son. I could not ask him too much as he was keen to hurry off and get his hands bandaged up. What exactly happened?
Ha ha, truly? No doubt the experience will serve him well.
Perhaps that kind of training is exactly what he needs to become a strong warrior like yourself. He may not like it, but he shall need to suffer if he wants to grow stronger.
